thread.title: Surgeons remove 6-pound tumor from girl's jaw at Cohen Children's
thread.title_full: Surgeons remove 6-pound tumor from girl's jaw at Cohen Children's

title: Surgeons remove 6-pound tumor from girl's jaw at Cohen Children's
text:
Surgeons remove 6-pound tumor from girl’s jaw at Cohen Children’s   5:09 PM By Jonathan Schifman 
  Janet Silva stands with her mom Phillomena (right), Elissa Montanti of the Global Medical Relief Fund (left) and doctors David Hoffman ( second from left) and Armen Kasabian (second from right) on Thursday, March 9, 2017 at Cohen Children's Medical Center in New Hyde Park. Dr. Hoffman and Dr. Kasabian performed a pro-bono surgery on Janet to remove a 6-pound tumor from her jaw. (Credit: Newsday / Alejandra Villa) 
When Janet Silva arrived at the Cohen Children’s Medical Center in November, she covered her face with a scarf and would not look doctors in the eye. The 12-year-old girl from Gambia was afraid to show the six-pound tumor in her jaw that hampered her ability to breathe, speak and eat. 
Now Janet is preparing to return home, free of her tumor and able to speak and eat normally, thanks to a... Continue Reading
